description:
'''Britney Jean Spears''' (born December 2, 1981) is an American singer. Dubbed the "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Princess of Pop]]", she is known for reviving [[teen pop]] and [[Cultural impact of Britney Spears|her influence on pop music and culture]] in the 21st century. Spears has sold 150 million records worldwide, making her one of the [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling music artists of all time]].

Spears signed with [[Jive Records]] in 1997 and rose to fame with her [[dance pop]]-imbued first two studio albums, [[...Baby One More Time (album)|''...Baby One More Time'']] (1999) and [[Oops!... I Did It Again (album)|''Oops!... I Did It Again'']] (2000). Both rank amongst the [[List of best-selling albums|best-selling albums of all time]], with the former yielding the U.S. [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] number-one single "[[...Baby One More Time]]", one of the [[List of best-selling singles|best-selling singles in history]]. Adopting a more mature and provocative image, she released the [[pop music|pop]] albums [[Britney (album)|''Britney'']] (2001) and ''[[In the Zone]]'' (2003); public scrutiny and personal challenges influenced the [[electropop]] record [[Blackout (Britney Spears album)|''Blackout'']] (2007). Spears' electropop albums [[Circus (Britney Spears song)|''Circus'']] (2008) and [[Femme Fatale (Britney Spears album)|''Femme Fatale'']] (2011) spawned the U.S. number-one singles "[[Womanizer (Britney Spears song)|Womanizer]]" and "[[Hold It Against Me]]". Spears embarked on [[Britney: Piece of Me|a 2013–2017 concert residency]] to promote ''[[Britney Jean]]'' (2013) and ''[[Glory (Britney Spears album)|Glory]]'' (2016).

Spears' life—including her high-profile relationships and personal struggles—has received widespread media coverage. After a [[mental breakdown]] in 2008, she was placed under a conservatorship. She stepped back from touring in 2019 to focus on the [[Britney Spears conservatorship case|conservatorship case]], sparking the #FreeBritney movement and the release of ''[[Framing Britney Spears]]'' (2021). The conservatorship was ended in 2021 after her public testimony alleging abuse by her management and family. Her 2023 memoir, ''[[The Woman in Me (memoir)|The Woman in Me]]'', debuted at number one on [[The New York Times Best Seller list|''The New York Times'' Best Seller]] list. Other ventures include her starring role in the [[comedy-drama]] film [[Crossroads (2002 film)|''Crossroads'']] (2002) and launching successful products, such as the fragrance [[Fantasy (fragrance)|Fantasy]], which generated over $1.5 billion in sales.

Spears is the fourth best-selling female album artist of the [[Nielsen SoundScan]] era, as well as the best-selling female album artist of the 2000s. She was listed as the world's [[Forbes list of the world's highest-paid musicians#Female|highest-paid female musician]] in 2001 and 2012 by ''[[Forbes]]''. [[List of awards and nominations received by Britney Spears|Spears' accolades]] include a [[Grammy Award]], 15 ''[[Guinness World Records]]'', six [[MTV Video Music Awards]], and seven [[Billboard Music Award|''Billboard'' Music Awards]] (including the [[Billboard Millennium Award|Millennium Award]]); she also has a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]]. [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']] named her [[Billboard's Greatest Pop Stars of the 21st Century|one of the greatest pop stars of the 21st Century]]. ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' named Spears one of the [[Time 100|100 most influential people in the world]] in 2021.
